intro: Sophiopsis, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to southern Africa and consists of several species, most notably Sophiopsis capensis. The plants are characterized by their milky sap, which is a distinguishing botanical feature. They typically have woody stems and produce small, clustered flowers. Sophiopsis species are often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions.
